page.title: 02ENVIRONMENT-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: Our area is in the Fens, near the Wash. The land on which we live was reclaimed from the sea, something that was started by the Romans and is still going on today.We are about two metres above sea level, and since the land is very flat you can see for miles. To make farming more efficient, farmers used to take down hedges and trees to create larger fields, but this drove the wildlife away as they had no cover to breed and feed in.It has also made our area rather windswept because of the lack of shelter, and many of us have planted hawthorn or leylandii hedges to protect our homes. The spraying of crops has also had a bad effect on wildlife, as even the dykes which criss-cross our area can be affected.
